title: Haigh Hall Country Park Walking Route

images.title: David Hignett / Haigh Hall
images.caption: Haigh Hall. Once a pretty impressive country house built by the local Baron's family, this building will be the venue for my younger daughter's wedding in 2006. Haigh, by the way is pronounced "Hay". Hard "g" pronunciations make locals snigger and invite you to pronounce "Mesnes".

images.title: ray blow / Entrance to Walled Garden at Haigh Hall
images.caption: Entrance to Walled Garden at Haigh Hall

images.caption: Turning leaves

images.caption: Bridge over Leeds Liverpool canal

images.caption: Santa Special on the Miniature Railway

images.title: Walled Garden - Haigh Hall Country Park by Anthony Parkes, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Summer colours in the walled garden

description: Enjoy a pleasant walk around this large country park near Wigan in Greater Manchester. The walk includes a stretch along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal before heading through peaceful woodland and parkland. There's 250 acres to explore with magnificent views across the Douglas Valley to the Welsh Hills. There is also a miniature steam railway track around the grounds.
